DataElement.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Diagnosis Result Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number to represent the numeric value for a human immunodeficiency virus viral load (the number of HIV viral particles in a sample of blood plasma) assay performed on an individual at the time of diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Diagnosis Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a human immunodeficiency virus viral load (the number of HIV viral particles in a sample of blood plasma) assay performed.__The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._class to hold instances used as the filler for the property has_result_The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME.:The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.:A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.
A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric result for a laboratory test performed to measure the viral load.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Head and Neck cancer with HIV clinical assessment CRF from MD Anderson SPOREs.
